element.name: Old Stile Cache by daraconn, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

description.p: The cache is a small lock-and-lock box. It is hidden in the townland of Killegar, in the vicinity of the ruins of an early Christian church. When hidden it contained logbook and pencil, a clockwork toy, some cool animal stickers, TB "Escargot" and a Slovenian bank-note. It is approximately 800 metres from the road along a public right of way.

element.long-description:
Access
Car/Cycle The recommended way to access this cache is from the R117 Dublin-Enniskerry Road. You can park safely at a disused gateway near the Texaco garage.
Public Transport Bus number 44 will bring you to where you need to start walking. Ask to be let off at "Monastery", or ring the bell when you see the Texaco petrol station.
Walking along the road, look carefully at the hedge on the west side and you will see a stone stile, camouflaged with tree branches. (N53°12.154' W6°10.650') Climb over (or step around) this first stile and you are on the old mass path to Killegar Church. It's a little overgrown, but perfectly passable.
When you come to the second stile (N53°12.120' W6°10.773'), note the "half-moon" feature that is said to be a typical feature of a mass-path. Cross the stile and enter a field. At some times of the year, you will be walking through long grass, at other times there will be meadow flowers. Although you are on a well-established right-of-way, you are now also on private property. Please respect the rights and legitimate concerns of the owner, especially if there are animals in the field, and keep well to the right-hand edge.
At the other end of the field, cross the third stile (N53°12.214' W6°10.990'). At this point you have a view of the surrounding hills.
The fourth stile (N53°12.334' W6°11.006') is in the opposite corner of the field. Again, it's probably best to walk around the edge of the field rather than cut straight across. When you cross the fourth stile, the cache is nearby.
Killegar Church Through the iron gate in the wall is the ruin of Killegar Church. If you find the gate is tied shut, please make sure to tie it again when you leave.
The chancel is still standing and the outline of the nave is still visible. Here you will find very ancient Christian artefacts including carved slabs and stones similar to those at Rathmichael, with patterns including cup marks, concentric circles and linear decorations, and an apparently broken cross that has been mounted and labelled as a "tau cross".
It is a peaceful place and the cemetery has continued in occasional use until recently.

ul.li:
2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Really liked this cache, up there with my most memorable. Would be interesting to see how many people come up this way these days? Pity to see the big structure near the final location, remnants of the Celtic Tiger I guess! Just so happens this cache was my 900th! TFTC, Spark_ie

2010-03-13T20:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by daraconn
Changed from "Ireland" to "Leinster, Ireland".

2009-12-05T20:00:00Z : Found it by photomaniac99
First find today after a nice little walk and climbing up and down stiles.
Was a bit wet and muddy but we wore "waterproof" walking shoes and the little one her wellies!
very interesting spot, I liked it and took a few photos (will upload them later ).

2009-12-05T20:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
Fields are muddy but passable. Great cache. Had a look around the old church ruins. The carved stones are impressive. On the way back across the field we saw some cattle... didn't look too closely to find out if they were cows or bulls as we had to cross the field anyway to get back to the car. Out: dollar coin In: dinosaur, marble, TB Daisy Adair, GC Pirate's Corp of Discovery: The Beginning Geocoin

2009-10-25T19:00:00Z : Found it by GRIMB0
Nice easy find, cool place....

wpt.name: GC14KTY
wpt.desc: Old Stile Cache by daraconn, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Old Stile Cache
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description:
Cache description

The cache is a small lock-and-lock box. It is hidden in the townland of Killegar, in the vicinity of the ruins of an early Christian church. When hidden it contained logbook and pencil, a clockwork toy, some cool animal stickers, TB "Escargot" and a Slovenian bank-note. It is approximately 800 metres from the road along a public right of way.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Access

Car/Cycle The recommended way to access this cache is from the R117 Dublin-Enniskerry Road. You can park safely at a disused gateway near the Texaco garage.

Public Transport Bus number 44 will bring you to where you need to start walking. Ask to be let off at "Monastery", or ring the bell when you see the Texaco petrol station.

Walking along the road, look carefully at the hedge on the west side and you will see a stone stile, camouflaged with tree branches. (N53°12.154' W6°10.650') Climb over (or step around) this first stile and you are on the old mass path to Killegar Church. It's a little overgrown, but perfectly passable.

When you come to the second stile (N53°12.120' W6°10.773'), note the "half-moon" feature that is said to be a typical feature of a mass-path. Cross the stile and enter a field. At some times of the year, you will be walking through long grass, at other times there will be meadow flowers. Although you are on a well-established right-of-way, you are now also on private property. Please respect the rights and legitimate concerns of the owner, especially if there are animals in the field, and keep well to the right-hand edge.

At the other end of the field, cross the third stile (N53°12.214' W6°10.990'). At this point you have a view of the surrounding hills.

The fourth stile (N53°12.334' W6°11.006') is in the opposite corner of the field. Again, it's probably best to walk around the edge of the field rather than cut straight across. When you cross the fourth stile, the cache is nearby.

Killegar Church

Through the iron gate in the wall is the ruin of Killegar Church. If you find the gate is tied shut, please make sure to tie it again when you leave.

The chancel is still standing and the outline of the nave is still visible. Here you will find very ancient Christian artefacts including carved slabs and stones similar to those at Rathmichael, with patterns including cup marks, concentric circles and linear decorations, and an apparently broken cross that has been mounted and labelled as a "tau cross".

It is a peaceful place and the cemetery has continued in occasional use until recently.

Additional Waypoints

S214KTY - 2nd Stile
N 53° 12.120 W 006° 10.773

S314KTY - 3rd Stile
N 53° 12.214 W 006° 10.990

S414KTY - 4th Stile
N 53° 12.334 W 006° 11.006

ST14KTY - 1st Stile
N 53° 12.154 W 006° 10.650

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Really liked this cache, up there with my most memorable. Would be interesting to see how many people come up this way these days? Pity to see the big structure near the final location, remnants of the Celtic Tiger I guess! Just so happens this cache was my 900th! TFTC, Spark_ie

First find today after a nice little walk and climbing up and down stiles.
Was a bit wet and muddy but we wore "waterproof" walking shoes and the little one her wellies!
very interesting spot, I liked it and took a few photos (will upload them later ).

Fields are muddy but passable. Great cache. Had a look around the old church ruins. The carved stones are impressive. On the way back across the field we saw some cattle... didn't look too closely to find out if they were cows or bulls as we had to cross the field anyway to get back to the car. Out: dollar coin In: dinosaur, marble, TB Daisy Adair, GC Pirate's Corp of Discovery: The Beginning Geocoin
